content: jellybean by marjorie brigham crochet this colorful coin purse for your favorite little miss bead crocheted purse and strap made in one piece with tubular construction and beaded single_crochet stitch materials bead # size color type needed seed 6/0 e red 800 rainbow seed 6/0 e red 500 mixed shades size 3/2 perle cotton yarn 100yds size d e or f hook or size that gives you the correct gauge 1 beading needle one decorative button finished size 4 x 4 1/4 with a 30 strap gauge 37 beads per sq inch 70 inches yarn per sq inch notes us pattern notation used chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet pm = place marker beaded chain draw bead up tight to work make a chain 1 beaded slip_stitch bss insert hook in st slide a bead up close yo and pull though st and loop on hook beaded single_crochet 1 bsc insert crochet hook into top of stitch in previous row yarn over and draw loop through slide the bead up to the stitch being worked yarn over and draw loop through both stitches on hook so that the bead is anchored above the stitch of the previous row front bead single_crochet 2 aka reverse bead single_crochet fbsc beads that you have crocheted in on the previous row will now be facing you push bead up as close to the hook as you can get it hold on to bead with your thumb insert hook over thread and into single_crochet thread over keep holding the bead pull through thread over pull through the two loops on hook bead should be in the front keep thread gauge a little tight so the bead this will force the bead to stay in place string the beads for this project you can mix all the colors in a dish and string them randomly or make a pattern alternating 2 of the main color with 1 of the mixed colors body of bag 1 chain 21 turn make one bsc in each of the next 20 stitches 2 instead of turning work keep going counter-clockwise on the piece do a bsc in each loop above the beads in the previous row this makes a second row of 20 beaded single crochets pm 3 begin the tube make 2 bsc in the first stitch then work 19 bsc across one side of piece make 2 bsc in next stitch and work 19 bsc across to end of second side of piece 1 round completed -- 42 stitches pm 4 work even on 42 bsc stitches per round until piece measures 4 tall flap row 1 work 8 bsc pm work 6 bsc turn and chain 1 row 2 work 6 fbsc turn and chain 1 row 3 work 6 bsc turn chain 1 row 4 work 6 fbsc turn chain 1 row 5 work 6 bsc turn chain 1 row 6 work 6 fbsc turn chain 1 row 7 work 5 bsc turn
